content: "{\"object\":\"value\",\"document\":{\"object\":\"document\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Working with assets\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-italic\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" walks you through the entire process of working with assets, from creating to backing up and restoring deleted content.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"1: \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"inline\",\"type\":\"link\",\"data\":{\"url\":\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BVydQ3x4Ctw&list=PLO9M7FOXF_QuDLgK2Bpie7-rjd_zeMnFl&index=2\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Working with assets | Overview\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\". Learn how to upload assets in your Contentstack repository and use them for your content creation process. \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"2: \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"inline\",\"type\":\"link\",\"data\":{\"url\":\"https://www.contentstack.com/docs/content-managers/working-with-assets/\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Creating and managing assets\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\". By default, entry versions are identified with numbers (Version 1, Version 2, etc.) However, you can assign a name (for e.g., Production Ready, Do Not Edit, etc.) to a version for easy identification.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"3: \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"inline\",\"type\":\"link\",\"data\":{\"url\":\"https://www.contentstack.com/docs/content-managers/asset-versions/\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Managing asset versions\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\". By default, asset versions are identified with numbers (for e.g., Version 1, Version 2). However, you can assign a name (for e.g., Production Ready, Do Not Edit) to an asset version for easy identification.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"4: \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"inline\",\"type\":\"link\",\"data\":{\"url\":\"https://www.contentstack.com/docs/content-managers/asset-folders/\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Creating and managing asset folders\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\". Create folders to organize assets in Contentstack. You can maintain nested folder structure going up to a depth of five levels.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"5: \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"inline\",\"type\":\"link\",\"data\":{\"url\":\"https://www.contentstack.com/docs/content-managers/secure-assets/\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Managing asset security\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\". Contentstack lets you secure assets by restricting public access. Unauthorized users will not be able to access secured assets.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"6: \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"inline\",\"type\":\"link\",\"data\":{\"url\":\"https://www.contentstack.com/docs/content-managers/bulk-operations-on-entries-and-assets/\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Performing bulk operations on entries\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\". Perform bulk operations, such as publish, unpublish, delete, or move, on entries and assets in a single action.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"7: \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"inline\",\"type\":\"link\",\"data\":{\"url\":\"https://www.contentstack.com/docs/content-managers/restore-content/\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Backing up and restoring content\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\". Contentstack helps you restore accidentally deleted components, such as stacks, entries, assets, or content types.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}}"
